instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging.
threads.message:
This board has had a lot of work done previously.  unknown history, no water damage.

<SIGNAL>PPBUSG3_HOT</SIGNAL> is 12.26v

BIL wasn't working originally due to broken pin, swapped connector and it works now.

<CHIP>U7000</CHIP>  -  20.22 ohms pins 27/28  3.05 ohms pins 17/18.

<TRANSISTOR>Q7055</TRANSISTOR> is not being turned on by the ISL, I've got 12.26v on pin 4.

I've changed the ISL with a new part, and <TRANSISTOR>Q7055</TRANSISTOR> from a donor, no change.

I'm running out of ideas. This should be more straightforward than this.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging.
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> on 12.26V means SMC is not communicating with ISL, it should be 12.56V..
Are you sure BILL is working??
Does it power on?
Battery detected on OS?
Also check your soldering job....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging.
threads.message: If BIL is doing something when pressing the button the SMC is probably ok. A dead ISL is likely but bad soldering is also possible. Check data lines from SMC to ISL
